description.0: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms.
description.1: Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

description.0: An unknown sword from the Northlands
An unknown bow from the Northlands
An unknown claymore from the Northlands
An unknown catalyst from the Northlands
Unknown Northlander Polearm
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords.
description.1: Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

description.0: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows.
description.1: Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

description.0: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores.
description.1: Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

description.0: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts.
description.1: Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

description.0: Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms.
description.1: Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

description.0: A strange beetle that inhabits areas rich with Electro energy. Its docile and sedentary temperament could not be more different from the fierce, demonic visage displayed on its armored shell.
Blossoms from the Sacred Sakura at the Grand Narukami Shrine, filled with a fondness for Inazuma.
A crystal that contains a sliver of Tatarigami power. Adding this material during smelting will greatly increase the strength and toughness of metals.

A vibrant plant that has also been named the "lycoris" by the poets. It was once thought extinct in the Inazuman archipelago, only to re-emerge now upon the battlefields. It is said that it blooms most enchantingly where much blood was spilled.
Even on windless days, this plant will tremble lightly amid the cries of thunder. The parts of it that resemble petals are in fact extensions of the leaves meant to protect the fragile flower.
A plant species that only grows in certain regions and islands of the ocean. Though it looks like a fungus of some sort, it actually comes from a substance secreted by certain soft-bodied organisms.
A precious pearl that grows in the coral of Watatsumi. Gives off a cool sheen like that of the moonlight.
The fruit of the Amakumo Grass, which grows on Seirai Island. You can hear it crackling with a tiny current if you hold it up to your ear.
A mushroom that glows like a night-light. Some curious power lies hidden within it.
A plant that grows in shallow seas. It adds a unique flavor to dishes.
A brightly-colored fruit. The flesh within transforms into food with a unique mouthfeel when cooked.
A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It is quite hardy indeed. Once it matures, the center of the cap will split open.
A fungus that grows in layers upon layers, like a sea of clouds, and which mostly grows on trees deep in the rainforest.
A holy and noble plant. The conditions for growth in its environment are very demanding. The flower buds can be processed to make valuable spices.
Growing in the forest wetlands, these plants only bloom at night with flowers as bright as the moon.
Growing in the hot humid rainforest, it is a fruit with a special spicy aroma. When ground to powder, spices can be made from it. It is the most valued spice plant in Sumeru.
Flowers from vines that grow on cliff sides. It is called a lotus only because it has a similar appearance to one. Aside from that, it bears no other similar properties to the lotus.
The fruit of a forest shrub. Its flesh is firm and sweet. It is said to have a calming effect on the mind.

Bright and beautiful, these pure purple flowers give off a pleasant fragrance that will give any passerby pause. While some like to call this a type of "rambler rose," its relative lack of multiple flowers means that it falls under a different floral classification.
A fruit that grows even in the most hostile of desert environments. Its vibrant crimson fruits are made even more lovely against a backdrop of yellow sand.
A fruit that grows on evergreen trees within desert oases. The flesh under the tough skin is thick, sweet, and delicious, making it an important food source amongst the desert peoples.

You can only find such husks deep in the desert where the Quicksand Eels breed. The hardened shell is meant to protect the Quicksand Eels' larval bodies until they finally acclimate to the conditions of the dry desert.
Crimson flowers that bloom on ancient battlefields. They can even flourish in the depths of the desert. Their drooping flowers seem to be in mourning for heroes long past.
A splendorous stone that can be found in the depths of desolate mountains, seemingly formed from congealed elemental energy.

A tenacious beetle that finds repose within the vast ocean of desert sand. The golden pattern on such beetles' shells hints at some deep relationship between them and the ancient ruins that dot the desert.
A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It seems to be bursting with vitality.
A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It seems to be a little singed.
A flower without seeds.
description.1: Once the earth remembers, the Viparyas will bloom.

description.0: Timber obtained from birches. It is easy to work with and produces smooth cuts. Furniture made using such wood is both beautiful and durable.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Timber obtained from Cuihua Trees. With its lovely color and unique make, it will surely be able to take on myriad uses upon undergoing suitable workmanship.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Timber obtained from pines. Its color and grain are nothing to write home about, but its unpretentious nature is elegant in its own right. The wood is very sturdy as well. In able hands, its products should be able to resist moth and rot alike.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Timber from the Sandbearer Tree. Said to be an exceptionally hardy plant resistant to wind and rain with a long lifespan.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Segments of bamboo that are light and far stronger than their humble appearance might suggest. It lets off a light fragrance.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Wood from the Cedar tree. Also known as the "Fragrant Cedar" for the aromatic oils it contains.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Wood from the tree known as "Faber's Fir." Widely used for its fine quality and attractive grain.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Timber obtained from Sakura Trees. Exquisite in quality and full of moisture, people say that it can lull people into dreams as sweet as the warm spring.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Timber from the Amur Maple. Excellent quality wood with a fine color and texture.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Wood from the Inazuman Cedar. It is soft, has straight veins, and gives off a light fragrance.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Wood from the Otogi Tree. It has just the right amount of moisture and oil, and as such has a great many uses.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Timber from the Brightwood Tree. It seems to have different properties from ordinary wood — soft but extremely resilient, easy to dye, and can be used for special purposes.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: The wood of the Karmaphala Tree. One can easily get a nice, smooth surface while working on this material and obtain a rather eye-pleasing result without going through any sophisticated processes.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: The wood of the Adhigama Tree. Can be found everywhere and therefore appears rather ordinary, but the wood is durable and easy to handle.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Wood of the Mountain Date Tree. Although it neither feels special to touch nor possesses a special texture, it retains water exceedingly well and is thus easy to grow.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Wood of the Athel Tree. It has a special texture and is resilient to both drought and humidity, making it very durable.
description.1: Can be used to create furnishings.

description.0: Some fabric of fine make. It will surely be of use in making furnishings.
Red dye. It will surely be of use in making furnishings.
Yellow dye. It will surely be of use in making furnishings.
Blue dye. It will surely be of use in making furnishings.
Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (Prologue).
description.2: This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
description.3: Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

description.0: Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (I).
description.2: This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
description.3: Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

description.0: Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (II).
description.2: This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
description.3: Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

description.0: Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (III).
description.2: This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
description.3: Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

description.0: Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (IV).
description.2: This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
description.3: Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

description.0: Collect all 10 pages to form Toki Alley Tales (V).
description.2: This page billows about in the breeze, seemingly having dropped from a very old novel.
description.3: Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

description.0: They say that in the past, when the fragile and short-lived mortals had yet to cross over the sea unto these lands, Inazuma was once a land that belonged to the tanuki. They say, too, that human history began as drunken tanuki nonsense... Welcome to Toki Alley, a place where history and wild tales intertwine.
The great tengu are naught but brutal braggarts, and especially when drunk! — Tanuki Historical Commentary

Mother once warned that a beautiful face can hide deceptive intentions. If she looks as lovely as the moonlight, she must either be a fox spirit, or some old bake-neko hag of significant power — Tanuki Historical Commentary
They say that those who make the ameonna cry will bring inescapable sorrow upon themselves. —Tanuki Historical Commentary
The tragedy of mortals is to lack self-knowledge, and that of the youkai is the lack of any such tragic troubles. —Tanuki Historical Commentary
Will this middle section filled with regret lead to a more interesting story thereafter?
A pass permit you obtained from Yae Miko. With this, you can enter Tenshukaku without restrictions and meet the Raiden Shogun.
description.1: You heard that this was made for emergencies, but that Yae Miko seems to have never had a chance to use it.

description.0: A creative snack made by adding sticky dango to milk. It is sweet and has a dense mouthfeel. All the customers who have tried it love it.
description.1: Still, it is dango that's been added in — drink too much and you might lose your appetite.

description.0: A realm dispatch that you obtained from Tubby. It seems to be able to allow your companions to come and go in your realm as they please...
description.1: After acquiring this item, you can invite companions to reside in your Serenitea Pot from the Placement Screen.

description.0: A seemingly special Sakura Bloom.
A crab that lives beside the Thunder Sakura. One wonders if it has any unique properties...
Fresh Seagrass. It looks like it would make a good meal.
A fresh sakura bloom. One can't be sure how Julie is going to use it in her dish...
Fresh snapdragon. It should be most suitable for cooking.
A fresh egg that should be most amenable to cooking.

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsunePrologue.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune: Prologue

description.0: Stories about memories are always closely intertwined with transience. This book is not all-new, but is an adaptation of "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune."

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneI.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (I)

description.0: The story of the "Black Fox" Itaru was actually the third volume in the original "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune." It appears at the front of this edition due to the writer's personal preference.

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneII.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (II)

description.0: This volume recounts the clash between "Black Fox Itaru" and the "Twin Oni of Tokaku." This tale was missing from the original text, but it was fortunately rediscovered at a later date. It is presented here in an edited form.

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneIII.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (III)

description.0: In the 500-year-old "Urakusai's Chronicles of the Six Kitsune," Youzan and Yui went on to have their own tales. But at this time, the mother-daughter pair are still reliant on Itaru to rescue them.

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneIV.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (IV)

description.0: This is the tensest tale of the series, said to have been written by Urakusai upon his return from Liyue. It is featured in full in this writer's adaptation.

Historical annals written by the famous Shogunate historian Kujou Michizane, who was known as one of the "The Three Kujou Dignitaries," or "The Great Calligrapher." It chronicles the history of Watatsumi Island in broad strokes.
The prefaces of the new light novel "The Saga of Hamavaran," now combined into their own separate volume due to a business model adjustment!

"How could this happen..." An ordinary scholar from Sumeru is unexpectedly assigned an unpopular specialization and ordered to go forth to the land of thunder and lightning... The curtains slowly rise on an adventure in the nation of many shores!

"'Ghost-calling'? Is that the same as 'spirit-warding' back home?" With confusing questions swirling in his mind, Hamavaran begins to speak with his newfound traveling companion. An unexpected journey begins!
Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, light-centuries of war unfold down on the planet's surface... With this grandiose opening comes an all-new tale of gallantry!

Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, no battle is legendary enough to be any more than a ripple in the silence for those who dwell upon the shore... But for the warriors in the thick of it, the war is all there is.

Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse lies a small chain of shattered isles, each of which has its own history, featuring tales heroic and trivial alike. This heroic tale is set in the time of the Suruga Shogunate.
There is a saying in Inazuma: "What are bandits but the children of war?" In times of tumult, even the harvest is a battlefield... See how this unfolds in the latest volume of "A Legend of Sword"!

Amid a sea of stars that spin in reverse, in nondescript village in a remote corner of the shattered isles, a ronin who has fallen upon hard times forms an alliance with a group of farmers. A great battle with the bandits draws near...
A tattered scroll containing information related to the Sacred Sakura Cleansing Ritual. Some pages seem to bear the cinnabar seal of some shrine.
A mushroom that did not originally grow in this area, but began to grow with wild profusion after absorbing sufficient special nutrition.
Crab bait that you got from Xudong. Laying it should attract crabs.
A diary left behind by someone in the wilderness that tells of the owner's unfortunate encounters at Jinren Island.

DiaryOfRoaldTheAdventurerRitou.name: Diary of Roald the Adventurer: Ritou

description.0: A diary left behind by the famed adventurer, Roald. The pages bear both the refreshing scent of sakura flowers and the bitterness of tobacco leaves.
An omamori given to you by Yae Miko.
description.1: "You can take this out and have a look whenever you think of me as well, you know?"

description.0: Obtained from Kujou Takayuki. None are privy to these contents save him and the Shogun — or so they tell you. It has the seal of the Kujou Clan Head on it.
Obtained from Kujou Takayuki. The contents are a bit ambiguous, but it isn't difficult to see that some of it involves an exchange of intelligence with the Fatui.
Yoimiya's pride and joy as the current owner of Naganohara Fireworks. It still seems to be in an experimental state. Nothing's going to go wrong... right?

The Special Magical Crystal Ore mentioned in the sailing log. It looks exactly the same as normal magical crystal ore, so there must be some other key factor that allows it to attract the Lunar Leviathan.

Slag left behind amidst some ore on Dragonspine. The valuable portions have been taken away, and the rest is just worthless, useless dross — or at least, that's how people might be inclined to see it. They would have carried it off as well otherwise, right?

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationI.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (I)

description.0: The princess who was prophesied to bring destruction witnesses the imminent fall of her nation, and it is at this moment when a wandering warrior descends from the skies, ignorant of the truth.
description.1: The pair's journey amidst the fires of an ancient warring period are about to begin!

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationII.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (II)

description.0: "A princess who brings destruction. Hah. Isn't that just an excuse for making war?"
description.1: They travel to the center of the world in search of the truth behind the prophecy.
description.2: The super-popular romantic adventure continues!

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationIII.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (III)

description.0: The two, who have entered the field of battle, finally witness the true Avici. The truth behind the fires of war that have swept across the world will be revealed here!
description.1: This volume comes with some super value-added extras!

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationIV.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (IV)

description.0: "Go back to hell, you jumped-up vengeful spirit!"
description.1: The riveting flashback chapter! What lies within the warrior's buried past?
description.2: Here comes a new chapter in the adventures of the princess who lost her nation and the warrior!

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationV.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (V)

description.0: "If this world requires your sacrifice to be saved, then it might as well burn."
description.1: Having reached the Sky Tower at the heart of the world at last, is this... finally the end of the pair's tale?

PrincessMinaOfTheFallenNationVI.name: Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation (VI)

description.0: The truth of the world is revealed — and what a terrible joke it is! Even when separated, the two cannot escape the chains of fate.
description.1: This may be the final volume of "Princess Mina of the Fallen Nation," but our story isn't over yet!

description.0: The preliminary volume of the "Flowers for Princess Fischl" series.
description.1: This work originally came in a violet and black wooden box as a limited edition gift, but many hardcore fans of the series who wanted to collect the whole saga were enraged by the great amount of content versus the small number of copies printed.
description.2: Due to this, Yae Publishing House would name this book "Volume 0" and sell it separately. Eventually, the original work, the boxed collector's edition, and Volume 0 would all come to be regarded as standard by fans.

description.0: A magazine by the Adventurers' Guild. Each issue introduces great sceneries across Teyvat. This issue includes a short traveling diary of Alice the Traveler in Inazuma.

A floating bottle that you fished up accidentally. The cork on this bottle has already been damaged, and the letter within has been mildewed. Thankfully, you discovered it in time, or its contents may have become lost to time altogether.

A standalone volume from the light novel series "Onibudou," written by Junkichi, a writer with Yae Publishing House. This collection contains the first two major arcs in the story. The quality of the serialized version varies quite a bit, but it still enjoys a degree of popularity amongst readers.
An omamori that Thoma gave you. It is said to be able to bring good luck.
A box of nails obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use it for repairs.
Wooden planks obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use them for repairs.
Rope obtained from a Treasure Hoarder camp. You can use it for repairs.
A sachet carried by Kito and Kina. It seems to have been woven from two smaller sachets before being carefully hidden in a wooden box.
A treasure map fragment left behind by Shitoki's brother. The vellum made from animal hide has the faint scent of sea-salt on it.

ATreasureMapLeftForShitoki.name: A Treasure Map Left for Shitoki

description.0: A complete Treasure Map made from several fragments. It gives off a faint sea-salt scent.
A sturdy bag that seems seawater-proof. It's full of blessing from the ancestral spirits.

A basic, common component often found in various creations of an ancient civilization, the function of which seems to be ensuring that these creations continue operating. Due to their close similarity in makeup to the components used in Pursina's Spikes, they can be used to replace its damaged parts. To think that Pursina's Spikes need such priceless objects to repair them... What a terrifyingly high-maintenance device.
A key that feels heavy in your hand. What door will it open?
A key that at least looks intact. One wonders who might have left it here...
A letter given to you by Sumida.
description.1: Give this letter to Kama in Ritou.

description.0: Yoimiya's new firework model. Who knows what it will do...

NewChroniclesOfTheSixKitsuneV.name: New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune (V)

description.0: Commentary regarding ancient matters that was specially added to the "New Chronicles of the Six Kitsune." If you find it an insipid, monotonous slog, dear reader, you may skip this volume. But as far as the author is concerned, this is one waste of words and emotion that cannot be avoided.
A check with the emblem of the Northland Bank printed on it. It can be exchanged for Mora.

This is an awful specimen of a treasure map. Its lines are random and its grids scrawled. You could probably sell this for a significant amount of Mora by claiming that it is the work of some stream-of-consciousness artist, though.
An Invigorating Kitty Meal made personally by Kiminami Anna. You're not certain if Neko will like it or not...
An example of the Ishine Script that was once used on Tsurumi Island.
description.1: It probably needs to be returned to some place in the Autake Plains.

APreliminaryStudyOfSangonomiyaFolkBelief.name: A Preliminary Study of Sangonomiya Folk Belief

description.0: This paper was written by Shihab Purbiruni, a scholar of modern history from Sumeru, two years before the civil war in Inazuma. It details the folk beliefs of Watatsumi Island and the Sangonomiya people, and puts forward some relatively new academic propositions.

TheLifeOfMouunTheShrineMaiden.name: The Life of Mouun the Shrine Maiden

description.0: For the people of Watatsumi, the legends of the Archon War are always filled with bitterness. Many of these millennia-old folksongs tell of a shrine maiden by the name of Mouun, who once rode upon the back of a sea monster, following the Great Serpent unto a tragic, moving end.

DebatesOnTheViceroyOfTheEast.name: Debates on the "Viceroy of the East"

description.0: The "Viceroy of the East," or "Touzannou" sung of in Watatsumi folk tradition is also known as the "Akuou" all across Raiden's domains. He was the first vassal ruler of the Great Serpent Orobashi, and he was also the last.

TreasuredTalesOfTheChoukenShinkageuchiI.name: Treasured Tales of the Chouken Shinkageuchi (I)

description.0: The first part of a traditional Inazuman novel. This particular volume is also known as "Shinkageuchi," and was once a restricted text. It contains a fantastical tale about the first Raiden Shogun and her kagemusha, depicting the benevolent sagacity of the first Shogun and the great valor of her kagemusha. However, due to the great popularity of another book known colloquially as "Raiden Reincarnation," many people became interested in stories of this kind. This book thus wound up being published in a haphazard manner.
This object seems to carry the Ishine Script that was once used on Tsurumi Island.
description.1: Bring this stone back to its rightful place.

DiaryOfRoaldTheAdventurerTsurumiIsland.name: Diary of Roald the Adventurer: Tsurumi Island

description.0: A diary left behind by the famed adventurer, Roald. The pages bear both the moist smell of the fog and a certain fungal scent.
Food that Thoma has prepared for the stray cats and dogs. This should go like hotcakes.
A batch of abandoned goods that you found at a warehouse at the south wharf. They essentially have no value.

The comb that Ningguang commissioned Mingxing Jewelry to repair. It belongs to a special informant. The damage to the comb was originally quite severe. The fact that it could be repaired to this extent is quite impressive indeed.
A pamphlet you obtained from the Ms. Hina Fan Club. You've got to say that the design looks kind of familiar...
A schedule that you created for Ningguang. The various items are all laid out in a clear and easy-to-read manner.
A schedule that you created for Ningguang. Simple, cogent, and to the point.
One of the ores required to create Wonder Cores. It has the power to resonate with Visions.
One of the ores required to create Wonder Cores. It can often be found where dawn meets dusk.
The core component to the Jade Chamber's mechanisms. When combined with Adepti Sigils, they can be used as the control center of the Jade Chamber.
Adepti Sigils made by Shenhe. They contain dense adeptal energy.
Documents announcing the villagers' migration. It states that the village was forced to relocate due to a god's remains.

This text contains all manner of strange legends about Mt. Tianheng's stones, including tales about many rare ores. It is said that if you stand in the middle of the lake south of Mt. Tianheng at dusk, you will find the legendary Subrosium.

The paper of this letter is slightly brittle and its ink is also a little smudged. It seems that both it and its owner have borne the assault of the waves. Unfortunately, while they encountered the same tribulations, they did not share the same fate.
A bottle containing Little Meng's various troubles. You wonder what's inside...
A special stone mined from the depths of The Chasm. It is said that it has catalytic properties.
description.1: It almost blazes with light in the gloomy mines, but it loses all such effects the moment one leaves The Chasm.
description.2: It seems to have other unique properties as well that have yet to be discovered.

description.0: The Ministry representative Muning gave you this note. Despite its short length, the word "prohibited" appears 8 times. If you give this to an adventurer named Zhiqiong, you will receive the aid you need.
This treasure map, once torn in two and kept in different hiding spots by the Treasure Hoarders, is now whole again.
description.1: If you follow the symbol on it, you might discover some special treasure!

description.0: A key to a certain storehouse that was hidden in a very obvious place, yet was never found by the Treasure Hoarders. Guess they're not as good at their job as they think, huh?
A key to a certain storehouse that was hidden in an incredibly obvious place, yet was never found by the Treasure Hoarders. They should probably go back to Hoarder school.

Cannonballs for the Mountainator, also known as the Safe Blasting Mechanism 2156. Although you used the Lumenstone Adjuvant to clear the unknown pollutants away, there is still a stench about them that can be detected even while covering your nose.
description.1: Ugh. Do you really have to touch it?

description.0: A dangerous substance made using the formula that Clitopho provided by compressing two Unmoving Essential Oils into one very dense bottle filled with Geo elemental energy.
description.1: Due to its fame as a highly unstable concoction, only madmen or experienced miners would dare use it, making it an uncommon sight indeed.
description.2: Handle with utmost care!

description.0: According to Khedive's initial speculations, this construct may be a "key" that could open the door to some ruin somewhere.
You took this picture of a strange rock that can be seen on the walls of The Chasm. You do not know what the patterns on the rock mean, but perhaps it could be of value to some researchers.
This letter, carefully crafted, and it is sealed in the name of "Ecologist Khedive Pursina."
description.1: You got this as a gift from Khedive. He claims that this is even more precious than gold, and can gain you the help of the House of Purbiruni.
description.2: Khedive himself believes monetary remuneration to be something of an insult... Hopefully, this doesn't prove to be a trend with people from Sumeru.

description.0: A strange gem left behind by a foe from the Abyss. If you look into it hard, it is almost as if you are looking into a long-borne dream shrouded by a deep fog.
Such keys are commonly found in the mines, but one wonders why it would appear here.

A suspicious object you obtained from Xamaran. It is claimed that this can clear the source of the foul energy. Condensed from the fungus' absorbed nutrients, the agglomeration of spores... and a thick sense of humor.
A cannonball with a fuse carefully attached. Ready to be fired at any time!

A toy belonging to miner Qi Ding's daughter. It looks pretty tattered and it's hard to imagine that any kid would like it. But the intricate stitch-work shows that this was once quite the pricey item.

One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm... possibly? It seems just like an ordinary Qingxin, and one that has newly sprouted as well, seeing as how its white petals have never been touched by dew.
description.1: Who knows how many people have once climbed up to high heights to pick one such fresh flower? Who knows if these flowers eventually bore witness to partings or reunions?

description.0: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm, a feather that fell from an eagle that flew over the top of the cavern. The Millelith seem to enjoy collecting these tough feathers to use as ornaments.
description.1: It is said that eagle feathers fit valiant warriors best, and so tend to be used to decorate the armor and arms of the bravest, such that they might break the enemy formation with all the swiftness of that great bird of prey.

description.0: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It seems quite old now, but the etchings are still very clear, and so it can still be used.
description.1: The sun is a rare sight down in The Chasm, and it is easy to lose track of time. But someday, this sundial will once again track the passage of years.

description.0: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. Neither stone nor gem, it somehow still became part of the Treasure Hoarders' loot hoard.
description.1: It has been filled by turns with fine wine, fair treasure, and blood. Now, its previous shame has been washed away, and it is ready to take on new memories.

description.0: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It was found hidden in the living quarters of the miners. A slightly less discerning eye might have mistaken it for a miner's hat.
description.1: It is heavily scarred and pitted, making one wonder how many miners' lives it must have saved.

description.0: One of the six lost offerings scattered throughout The Chasm. It was lost amid the ancient battlefield five hundred years ago. The long years have worn the edge of the spear-point away, but it still looks quite ominous nonetheless.
description.1: One can imagine that it was once wielded by a warrior most brave, earning the cheers of the young wherever it swept, even unto The Chasm itself.

description.0: A ring that you got off a Golden Weasel Thief. See how it glitters, see how it shines! The Weasel Thief must have planned on using it to attract a mate, and it does indeed look quite valuable. One imagines that its owner must be quite distressed at the moment.
A seemingly withered object that seems to, by normal judgment, be a seed. However, it still has a surprising amount of life in it yet.
description.1: Best not to eat it for now...

description.0: The raw ore from which Lumenstone may be found. If processed properly, it can be used to strengthen the Lumenstone Adjuvant you have. Why not hit Jinwu up and ask her?
A drifting bottle that contains Yue Chuan's reply to Little Meng. You wonder if it'll reach him...
Fresh soy milk. It'll go bad quick if improperly stored.
A metal key that you obtained from the Fatui. It should be able to open some kind of door.
A freshly-picked Calla Lily. Suitable for being used as a specimen.
A freshly-picked Small Lamp Grass. Suitable for being used as a specimen.
A freshly-picked Cecilia with a pleasant fragrance.

The core section of a Ruin Guard. Old and new versions of this device are incompatible, and it thus cannot be used to empower other objects. However, the leftover energy should be enough to power one Ruin Guard.
Date's key. Unfortunately, this will not open the treasury of a distinguished Enkanomiya family. It will only open the way to the Heterodoxa labyrinth.
This pile of Lavender Melons may have been collected and placed here by some kind of animal. They look a bit like Onikabuto from a distance.
Incense you got from Wang Ping'an. Looks to be of good quality.
An unknown construct that you discovered in the depths of The Chasm. It resembles an intricately-made cube.
As you were walking down the streets of Inazuma, someone stuffed this note onto your person. Two strange symbols are drawn on it.

A Bamboo Slip upon which Momoyo has applied some specially made elemental powder. Store and handle it with care! The powder has some measure of poison in it — and of course, you'll get yelled at for improper handling.

Fatui operational orders that you obtained from Lyudochka. They detail an operation that will take place in the future on Watatsumi Island. This intelligence is very important — peoples' lives are at stake here!
A bag that contains Lyudochka's Fatui uniform. Considering the controversial nature of Fatui uniforms, it is best not to let other people see this.
A specially made fortune slip that describes how your luck will be like today. There is nothing different about this Fortune Slip, save for the fact that you got it for the fake Bamboo Slip.
description.1: Whose fortune does this Fortune Slip describe?

description.0: A strange item that you fished up from the underground waterways in The Chasm. It's wet, and you cannot tell if this is a living or dead thing.
A simple diagram that Zhiqiong drew in haste. It indicates the general locations of several Bedrock Keys.
A Mora purse you found in a treasure chest. The feeling you had when weighing it was one of immense disappointment.
A Mora purse you found in a treasure chest. Compared to the previous purse you found, this one provides a decent amount more comfort.
A fish you just obtained from the river. It might be considered a gift from nature. It is so excellent that it only needs to be grilled a little to be delicious as can be.
Beautifully-Written Note
A letter that Yun Jin personally wrote to Shiyun. It seems to hold the key to turning the situation around.

The letter that Lyudochka asked someone from Yae Publishing House to pass on to you. It contains her reasons for leaving without saying why. However, whether you will accept her reasons for departing or not is a different story.
description.1: It was you who discovered her presence and changed her fate... Might you be able to do still more to change this ending for the better?

description.0: The Mora purse that Lyudochka left behind. It contains a decent sum of Mora, but even Paimon doesn't want to use it.
A certain ever-somnolent member of the Shuumatsuban wrote this Fatui Code Sheet.
description.1: Reading it does not merely let you know that "these Fatui speak very oddly indeed" — you can also feel the recorder's intense lethargy penetrating the paper in the form of saliva.

description.0: A purse you got from Mona. It contains the amount she needs to pay her rent.
A present that you got from Marjorie. You've heard that children will like it...
A gift you got from Viktor. He seems to have also put a letter under the gift box.
Fresh Wolfhooks that Schuster picked. Thankfully, they haven't been damaged by monsters yet.
A specially made fortune slip that describes how your luck will be like today. There is nothing different about this Fortune Slip, save for the fact that you used it to open Lyudochka's heart.
description.1: Now, this Fortune Slip has returned to your hands, along with her heartfelt blessings. If you've got the time, why not go to the Grand Narukami Shrine to see her?

TheMiraculousAdventuresOfTheTraveler.name: The Miraculous Adventures of the Traveler

description.0: "This is a rather orthodox light novel, with its contents essentially being an edited version of real life in Teyvat. What is surprising, however, is that the author seems to be highly knowledgeable about Watatsumi Island, with many vivid, almost lifelike descriptions." — Ms. Hina

A glaze crystal produced in the depths of The Chasm, this special Glaze Sand Crystal ore was one of many scattered about during the battle against the giant ruin machine. Glaze Sand Crystal ore is a regional specialty of The Chasm, but this one is different from the rest.
description.1: Under the radiance of the blue crystal and the power of the Abyss, a strange spiral pattern has emerged within this stone, and it is cold, almost chilling to the touch.
description.2: This once smooth crystal has been transformed into this shape by the great might that descended from the heavens and the miasma that arose from the earth's depths — and perhaps the form it has taken is itself a warning unto mortals.
description.3: If the interaction of these forces alone could twist stone and metal thus, if that ordinary heroine was truly able to witness the end of the pitch-dark path, how would she have faced the discovery she would make?

description.0: A mark symbolizing the recognition of Enkanomiya's Tokoyo Ookami.
description.1: They can be offered up to the Statue of the Vassals of Watatsumi, thus upgrading the Bokuso Box.

description.0: You discovered this mysterious stone while exploring the darkened realm of Enkanomiya.
description.1: The Light Realm gave humans additional means to resist the Abyss.

description.0: The bloodied and muddied insignia of a Fatui sergeant. You have no idea how it ended up in the depths of The Chasm.
A letter left behind by Corporal Nikolay. Its contents have long ceased to be whole.
You were asked by Xu from Feiyun Commerce Guild to deliver this to Huishan Hall's representative Muning, who is at The Chasm. It contains a rather sizable sum of Mora.

AFirsthandGuideToSummoningSpirits.name: A Firsthand Guide to Summoning Spirits

description.0: A light novel that has been popular in Inazuma lately. It contains all manner of bizarre tales involving ancient youkai.
You held a single sakura petal in your hand before leaving Raiden Makoto's realm of consciousness.
description.1: Its existence is a mystery. It appears no different from ordinary sakura petals, and there it silently sits in your storage just like any of the others. But you can no longer touch it, nor can you feel its weight or warmth. When an object loses any of the attributes that one would normally ascribe to it, how can its "existence" be proven for sure?
description.2: As you think back on the many sights the petal must have witnessed in the past, a certain guess comes to mind: that which sustains this sakura petal's existence must be someone's will. But as to who this person is, and whether they are intentionally or unintentionally keeping this petal in existence, neither can be known. Nor can you prove whether that willpower is one derived from yearning, trust, or gratitude.
description.3: Perhaps, when "that person's will" changes, so too will this sakura petal disappear.
description.4: Just to be safe, it might be best to check back from time to time and see if it still exists.

description.0: A special ore created due to the Watatsumi Goryou Matsuri. As Enkanomiya's environment has undergone extreme changes, the memories and thoughts of Watatsumi Omikami scattered throughout Enkanomiya have coalesced into medullae, which then transformed into ore.

A special plant that was produced via the Watatsumi Goryou Matsuri. With the awakening of the Sangacorexes, the elemental energies within Enkanomiya have been pacified. This is a naturally-growing fertilizing crop that will turn into loam within the soil once it decays.

A jewel that fell from the armor of a special Shadowy Husk after you defeated it. You can feel a will surging within it. Perhaps it might be more correct to say that this will manifested itself through the armor rather than manipulated it.
A small accessory you got from Kokomi. It seems to be the fragment of another object. According to her, it might come in handy at some point.
A map drawn by Tsumi. There are some markings on it.
The heirloom blade of the Iwakura Clan.
description.1: Although the one who forged this blade possessed great skills, and though it is true that this sword has slain many a foe, it does not possess any special powers. Nor has the Iwakura Succession ever obtained a Vision. Their excellent swordsmanship was purely a result of their honing of mind, body, and technique.
description.2: This blade has been submerged in water for a long time and seems to have completely rusted.

description.0: Someone from the Kanjou Commission left this behind. You should be able to use this to rescue Shinnojou.
A seemingly ordinary stone slate. Who knows what secrets it might hold...
The final stone slate you obtained. Secrets within secrets, eh?
A somewhat complete note, written in a neat hand. It seems to have been a letter left for an old friend.

A letter you found off one of the Black Serpent Knights. The name of the letter's recipient is neatly written: "Katarina Snezhevna, My Dear Elder Sister," while the sender's name is written somewhat haphazardly, though you can make out the words "Your Brother, Nikolay Snezhevich."
Seasoning created using the recipe given to you by Nazafarin. It has a tangy aroma and serves to bring out the flavor in any dish it is added to.
A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

TheAlmightyAratakiGreatAndGloriousDrumal.name: The Almighty Arataki Great and Glorious Drumalong Festival!

description.0: This is a most lavish invitation letter, whether in its construction or its content. The letter describes a large-scale, deep-rooted, nationally-acclaimed event in which you shall be a most important guest, the radiant star of the show.

This was originally a ledger, but appears to have been re-purposed as a site log instead. The latest daily happenings at The Chasm have been scribbled into its pages, though not much of this information is of any particular use.
A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!
A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!
A letter left by a young adventurer. There is a slightly bitter scent of Qingxin on this piece of paper.
A list of guests and their time of arrival on ships bound for the Irodori Festival.
description.1: Your task is to welcome and lend your aid to guests according to the information presented in this schedule.

description.0: A summary of the information concerning the Five Kasen, which you got from Yae Publishing House's Hirayama.
description.1: Although the content is quite sparse, you can still get the gist of the Five Kasen and the great flair they had in their heyday.

description.0: A sheet of paper Venti found in a cargo crate within the wharf warehouse. A poem entitled "The Five Kasen's Splendor: Suikou" is written upon it.

TheFiveKasensSplendorAoiNoOkina.name: The Five Kasen's Splendor: Aoi no Okina

description.0: A sheet of paper Xingqiu found beneath his luggage. Someone seems to have left it there while he was napping. A poem entitled "The Five Kasen's Splendor: Aoi no Okina" is written upon it.

A sheet of paper that some mysterious person left behind. This person must have originally intended to leave it on Kazuha's person, only to be unexpectedly detected by the latter and forced to flee in a hurry, leaving the sheet behind. A poem entitled "The Five Kasen's Splendor: Akahito" is written upon it.
Ayaka found this on a flower stand at the festival venue. This sheet of paper, however, only contains one line of text.
An ancient forging blueprint. The Shogun once ordered the Kaedehara Clan to forge a Goshintou according to it.
description.1: After being soaked in water, it becomes clear that some of the text has been blurred — someone tampered with the blueprint, dooming the forging to failure and triggering the tragedy that followed...

description.0: A blank piece of paper that was hidden in an old flower pot. When dipped in water, it reveals a long-sealed secret.
description.1: After telling everyone about the truth that was concealed within, Kazuha said that "this letter may still be of use to you," before handing it over to you.

description.0: A very thick poetic manuscript. If you were to give it a generous review, it would be "mediocre," while an honest review would see it getting a "hard to read." It resembles bone-dry historical records more than it does poetry.
A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!
A delicious dish with some extra seasoning! It gives off a titillating aroma... But whose tastes will this dish suit? Invite your friends, invite your pals — get them to try this new dish!

This was originally intended to buy bedding and other materials by which sleep quality might be improved, but on the other hand, Sayu has no wish to sleep forever just yet.

StatueOfHerExcellencyTheAlmightyNarukami.name: Statue of Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, God of Thunder

description.0: The Statue of Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, God of Thunder that Sara has been hankering after. Go on, go give it to her.
A shopping list of books compiled by Kokomi. All the genres, unit prices, and amounts of the books she desires have been written down here in her elegant script.
The gift that Gorou got when helping Kokomi purchase books during the Irodori Festival. Gorou then gave it to you as thanks for accompanying him.
description.1: Every time you look at it, you can't help but remember the sight of every hair on Gorou's body standing on end as he heard the word "fox."

description.0: It is said that opening this will bring you bad luck. It seems lighter than you assumed it might be...?

ACompleteChartOfAkosTreasure.name: A Complete Chart of Ako's Treasure

description.0: A complete nautical chart pieced together after all four parts of the clue were collected, leading to the treasure hidden by Ako Domeki and company before they left this place.

OutlanderBrigadeWhenTheWindOfDeathBlewTo.name: "Outlander Brigade: When the Wind of Death Blew Towards the Blond Samurai" Script

description.0: A "film script" you obtained from Xavier.
A new film script that Xavier finished overnight, much thicker than his last one. What you have here merely contains Act I.
description.1: The willpower one can harness to achieve a goal is truly amazing.

description.0: "In essence, the great battle in space is no different from the armed conflict between commoners which took place ten years ago on that barren planet..." Soon, the name of that man shall be known across the Galaxy, matching that of the Emperor.

ShogunAlmightyRebornAsRaidenWithUnlimite.name: Shogun Almighty: Reborn as Raiden With Unlimited Power

description.0: A popular light novel in Inazuma which tells the story of a mere mortal suddenly turning into the Raiden Shogun. The story is well-received for its novel plot and has inspired many light novelists.

A popular light novel in Inazuma which tells the story of the "good-for-nothing" Shogun and the "good-at-everything" Kitsune Guuji. The novel is in the same collection as "Shogun Almighty: Reborn as Raiden With Unlimited Power," but not by the same author. What they share in common, however, is their popularity.

Message From the Editor: "Let's Go, Dodoco!" is the combined work of an older girl and a younger girl. Every chapter brims with their gentleness and good wishes, as the story is intended as a gift to our readers. I hope this book — in spite of its small volume — can bring you some simple joy after a long day of work.

Before Ako Domeki and company left, they had hidden a treasure here and agreed to unearth it when they met in the archipelago again. The secret of where the treasure is was split into four parts, and this is the first part.

Before Ako Domeki and company left, they had hidden a treasure here and agreed to unearth it when they met in the archipelago again. The secret of where the treasure is was split into four parts, and this is the second part.

Before Ako Domeki and company left, they had hidden a treasure here and agreed to unearth it when they met in the archipelago again. The secret of where the treasure is was split into four parts, and this is the third part.

Before Ako Domeki and company left, they had hidden a treasure here and agreed to unearth it when they met in the archipelago again. The secret of where the treasure is was split into four parts, and this is the fourth part.
One of the ingredients for making the elixir Arahaoma. "Yajna" is said to mean "the realization of death."
One of the ingredients for making the elixir Arahaoma. "Zohrah" is said to mean "lost in a tipsy dream."
One of the ingredients for making the elixir Arahaoma. "Barsam" is said to be a sacred tree that has long vanished in history.
An elixir of Aranara. A mere drop of it is all it takes to unveil Aranara's pure and pristine dreams to the forest.
A thick soup that Jinwu made for sick miners. It's nutritious, fragrant, and makes you feel warm inside when you drink it.
description.1: Don't let it go cold, now.

description.0: A bag of decorations that Old Chou gave you as compensation for Tang Wuchou's misfortunes. They are very roughly made, owing to having been manufactured by the Treasure Hoarders within The Chasm using smuggled ore, and can barely be considered to possess any aesthetic qualities at all. As such, there is no hope at all of them selling well in Liyue. The only thing good you could say about these ornaments is that they are at least made using the right materials...
An item you obtained after traversing the nursery. It is translucent and seems to contain the memories of the earth.
A log indicating how to find the clues, left by the ones who hid them. If you navigate as it directs, you may indeed find a clue regarding the treasure left by Ako Domeki and company.
A log indicating how to find the clues, left by the ones who hid them. If you proceed as it directs, you may indeed find a clue regarding the treasure left by Ako Domeki and company.

A log indicating how to find the clues, left by the ones who hid them. If you proceed as it directs, you may indeed find a clue regarding the treasure left by Ako Domeki and company. Still, this is, what, the second log you've found already? Hopefully, it can lead you directly to the clue this time.
A mysterious shard engraved with a pattern of stars. It seems to be the key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.
A fruit with mysterious powers.
description.1: Bija is indispensable for helping Rana, and the Vasoma Fruit is indispensable for obtaining Bija.

description.0: A garland woven by Arama.
description.1: Garlands of this kind represent the blessings from all of Vanarana and once channeled endless powers during the fight with Marana's Avatar. But their blazing light has now faded, perhaps because they burned so relentlessly.
description.3: Every flower on the garland is connected with the lovely, tiny heart of an Aranara, and all of them together constitute the gate to Mahavanaranapna. Aranara will support those who wear such garlands. As friends, they ease the wearers' pains, ward off their nightmares, aid them through lightless days, and fill the emptiness in their hearts.

description.0: The crystallization of what is most precious to Aranara. It is not only a fruit but also a seed of hope.
A flower gifted to you by Arana.
description.1: You promised Arana that the evil shall be punished.

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Araja.
description.1: Araja seems to have lost important memories.

description.0: A flower gifted to you by an unknown Aranara.
description.1: A symbol of Aranara friendship. One who receives this flower willingly recognizes this friendship.

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Arapandu.
description.1: Can power the Varuna Contraption and adjust the amount of water contained within the earth, thus breathing new life into the forest.

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Arakunti.
description.1: Happy moments spent with friends are like Nilotpala Lotuses in the water.

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Aranakula.
description.1: Fearful though Aranakula was, this little creature still ventured into the Fungus-infested forest to tend to "the Memory of Stone."

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Arabalika.
description.1: It seems to contain the power to destroy a Ruin Guard with one strike.

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Aranaga.
description.1: "Season of rain returns, plants rejoice... The pomegranate sings, the apples clap."

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Aranakin.
description.1: "Wind that doesn't return, water that doesn't flow backwards... Sweet dreams and bitter aftertastes."

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Aragaru.
description.1: "Old leaves, swollen fruit... Drifted dreams, fallen flowers."

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Ararycan.
description.1: There is neither soil nor water inside the Ruin Golem. It must be a nightmarish place for Ararycan.

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Araesha.
description.1: The biggest mystery is perhaps why Araesha describes the riddles as being "delicious"... Is it because they are all about food?

description.0: A flower gifted to you by Arakara.
description.1: For Arakara, who nurtures Viparyas, flowers given to friends must be most precious indeed.

description.0: Flowers gifted by Arapacati and her brothers.
description.1: Longing to be connected as "siblings" are, these Aranara have each taken on the role of sister or brother. Their obsession with cooking stems from the wish to share food with family.
description.2: That being said, an Aranara's tastebuds are not to be trusted.

description.0: Flowers gifted to you by the Song Gatherers.
description.1: "No matter how dark the sky and land get, as long as your spirit emits warm, golden light like the sun, there will always be hope."

description.0: Flowers gifted by Aralila and Aranishat.
description.1: We ourselves are the strongest. Of that, there is no doubt!

description.0: A flower gifted by Arakanta.
description.1: Arakanta used to love hanging out with Rishboland Tigers. But now, he has created a new game for his Nara friend.

StoriesOfYouAndTheAranara.name: Stories of You and the Aranara

description.0: So many wonderful things transpired during your adventures with the Aranara. In the world of the Aranara where stories are highly valued, maybe someone is willing to "exchange" these with you.
This map was contained within the plans that a Fatuus named Oleg accidentally dropped. All the encampment positions and Fatui patrol routes have been marked out here.
A bottle of spring water. The Glacial Spring Water that Blazing Heart desires should be stored within.
An uncanny petal. At first glance, it seems like ice molded into the shape of a petal, but it is quite soft to the touch.
description.1: "Plant my petal at the ending point of the intersection of melodies, and what had once sunk into the earth will re-emerge with the music."
description.2: That's what Frozen Soul said.

description.0: An elegantly-written note.
A letter.
Mountain rocks. They look suited in all ways to be used as base materials from which to carve rocks for the bonsai's left side.
Mountain rocks. They look suited in all ways to be used as base materials from which to carve rocks for the bonsai's right side.
Carving tools that you found on the Mondstadt-style mountains. You might be able to use them to carve the base materials you have into a rock garden.
A small gear. No matter how small a gear is, it can be of use sometime, perhaps?
A medium gear. "The pivotal one," as we call it.
A gear that can transmit a measure of force. After all, momentum is key.
A large gear. Its weight and the noise it emits will make an impression for sure.
A rather small duplex gear. Double the flanks, double the labor hours.
A fairly large duplex gear. The bigger the size is, the more it takes to manufacture.
A gear that requires power to rotate. It can be very helpful. Really. Can someone help rotate it, please?
Slightly soft bonsai rocks. They seem to be able to summon a leisurely and comfy breeze. These can be placed on the left side of the bonsai.
Slightly soft bonsai rocks. They seem to be able to summon a leisurely and comfy breeze. These can be placed on the right side of the bonsai.
Rocks of moderate hardness. It is said that a glimmer will dance across the surface of these rocks during stormy weather. These can be placed on the left side of the bonsai.
Bonsai rocks of moderate hardness. It is said that a glimmer will dance across the surface of these rocks during stormy weather. These can be placed on the right side of the bonsai.
Very hard bonsai rocks that have an air of firmness to them. These can be placed on the left side of the bonsai.
Very hard bonsai rocks that have an air of firmness to them. These can be placed on the right side of the bonsai.

Water obtained from the source of the rivers flowing across Apam Woods. According to Arapas, soup made from such spring water is a Supreme Delicacy. But one wonders if it really is any different from ordinary water...
A box full of components. They all look quite intact, perhaps because monsters have no interest in them...
You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.
You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.
You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.
You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.
A wrinkled note with horrendously slanted handwriting.
Used to redeem Mirrorpool Horned Owl: Turning
Used to redeem Mirrorpool Horned Owl: Dancing
Used to redeem Mirrorpool Horned Owl: Air Time
Used to redeem Thundering Horned Owl: Turning
Used to redeem Thundering Horned Owl: Dancing
Used to redeem Thundering Horned Owl: Air Time
Used to redeem Flowfire Horned Owl: Turning
Used to redeem Flowfire Horned Owl: Dancing
Used to redeem Flowfire Horned Owl: Air Time
Used to redeem Traveling Horned Owl
Used to redeem Mirrorpool Triped: Tipping
Used to redeem Mirrorpool Triped: Jiggy
Used to redeem Mirrorpool Triped: Sitting
Used to redeem Thundering Triped: Tipping
Used to redeem Thundering Triped: Jiggy
Used to redeem Thundering Triped: Sitting
Used to redeem Flowfire Triped: Tipping
Used to redeem Flowfire Triped: Jiggy
Used to redeem Flowfire Triped: Sitting
Used to redeem Traveling Triped
A part of the "Evermotion Mechanical Painting" that Félix Yogue is trying to restore.
A part of the "Evermotion Mechanical Painting" that Félix Yogue is trying to restore.
A part of the "Evermotion Mechanical Painting" that Félix Yogue is trying to restore.
A part of the "Evermotion Mechanical Painting" that Félix Yogue is trying to restore.
A part of the "Evermotion Mechanical Painting" that Félix Yogue is trying to restore.
A part of the "Evermotion Mechanical Painting" that Félix Yogue is trying to restore.
A research log excerpt with plenty of crinkles. The handwriting is still very much legible.
You found this note in the mysterious space. Its content seems similar to that of a journal.

The crystalline core component that was missing from the curious Fatui machine. According to Persikov's manuscript, the machine can be restarted if three such cores are found and inserted into the device.
Old Yellowed Notes
Mysterious Letter
A Seemingly Waterproof Note
A key related to a certain mysterious plant. It seems to be able to open some door somewhere...
A letter the head housemaid, Adelinde, just received. It needs to be sent to Dawn Winery for archiving.
description.1: The paper is slightly wrinkled. Maybe the person who wrote the letter was in a hurry and couldn't find a desk.

description.0: A gift from Diluc. A bottle of grape juice with luxury packaging. It is something Paimon has long been looking forward to, but more so a memento of the time when you and your friends handled the crisis together.
description.1: It is also Diluc's personal favorite, produced using only Dawn Winery's best quality grapes.
description.2: Being "Master Diluc's favorite grape juice" seems to have inestimable commercial value...

description.0: Soil soaked with Slime Condensate. What will Akim use this sticky stuff for?
Soil collected from Whopperflower roots. What will Akim use it for?
Moist soil collected from the bottom of rocks. What will Akim use it for?
A translucent crystal that seems to hold coalescent starlight within it. This item seems to be key to solving a certain mechanism puzzle somewhere.
Ham meant to be used for resupply. It will keep longer in low-temperature conditions.

A contract penned and signed personally by the Prinzessin der Verurteilung herself. It may be used to authorize the opening of navigational sites. Those who should produce this letter of warrant shall be authorized forthwith to spread their black feathers where dawn meets dusk, and envelop the skies in night's own embrace.
Special "Concresoil" Akim made for Nima. What kind of pot warriors will Nima make with it?
You can't tell whether this soil is fertile or not.
description.1: What will Akim use this for?

description.0: "Concresoil" of poor quality. It looks to be in terrible condition...
An official missing person poster with the Tenryou Commission's symbol on it.
A key found in the Golden Apple Archipelago, seemingly able to open a lock somewhere...
A bird egg needed for making Angler Kayvan's special bait. This special egg was collected from a specific tree, but it does not look particularly special.
A mushroom needed for making Angler Kayvan's special bait. For some reason, mushrooms of this kind hold some appeal for monsters such that they would willingly collect them...
Mint needed for making Angler Kayvan's special bait. For some reason, mints of this kind hold some appeal for monsters such that they would willingly collect them...
Harra Fruit needed for making Angler Kayvan's special bait. For some reason, Harra Fruits of this kind hold some appeal for monsters such that they would willingly collect them...
Sweet Flower needed for making Angler Kayvan's special bait. For some reason, Sweet Flowers of this kind hold some appeal for monsters such that they would willingly collect them...
Emergency food that Tighnari prepared for Haypasia. Paimon took a peek into the lunchbox, finding some traditional Sumeru delicacies that looked very tasty inside.
A letter from Tighnari to Haypasia. In the letter, Tighnari explains your identity and situation after coming to Sumeru and requests that Haypasia help clear up your doubts.
Food that you have specifically prepared for Haypasia. The box contains Sweet Madame and Radish Veggie Soup. You hope Haypasia will like it.
A letter from Tighnari to Rohawi, a researcher from Amurta. In the letter, Tighnari requests that Rohawi use his prowess in collecting information to help you.
description.1: Rohawi's address in Sumeru City is also attached therein.

description.0: A bag of Mora given by Alhaitham for purchasing Canned Knowledge. You can feel the heavy weight of the bag.
Canned Knowledge purchased at Dori's booth with the Mora given to you by Alhaitham. Packaged as common commodities to keep it low-key.

Canned Knowledge labeled "Swordfighting Techniques VIII." It was bought from Dori's booth at the price of 100,000 Mora at Paimon's instigation. You have no idea where the first seven in the series are, but things like "Combat Techniques" will always be useful. Well, probably.
A bag of Mora provided by Alhaitham for buying the intel on the whereabouts of the Divine Knowledge Capsule.
A picture of a scene where the "Divine Knowledge Capsule" is being traded.
description.1: In the picture, there is Mizri, the leader of Ayn Al-Ahmar, and the Divine Knowledge Capsule giving off a red glow in his hand.

description.0: A code chart given to you by Alhaitham. Seems like whoever seeks to purchase "special commodities" from Dori has to provide the right code first.
description.1: Check this code chart before visiting Dori's contact, just in case.

description.0: This Imaging Conch should have been placed somewhere else but was abandoned here by someone, causing it to project images out of their proper order. Return it to its rightful place, and who knows what you might find...

This Imaging Conch should have been placed somewhere else but was abandoned here by someone, causing it to project images out of their proper order. Return it to its rightful place, and who knows what you might find...

This Imaging Conch should have been placed somewhere else but was abandoned here by someone, causing it to project images out of their proper order. Return it to its rightful place, and who knows what you might find...

PrescriptionMedicationFromBimarstanForGu.name: Prescription Medication from Bimarstan for Gurgen

description.0: Medication prescribed for Gurgen. It should be taken along with abundant rest.

PrescriptionMedicationFromBimarstanForAz.name: Prescription Medication from Bimarstan for Azra

description.0: Medication prescribed for Azra. It smells incredibly bitter.

PrescriptionMedicationFromBimarstanForAf.name: Prescription Medication from Bimarstan for Aftab

description.0: Medication prescribed for Aftab. Taker of this medication needs to practice a bland diet.
Harra Fruit needed for making Angler Kayvan's special bait. For some reason, Harra Fruits of this kind have an appeal to monsters. They would often linger around areas where these Harra Fruits are...
A special Zaytun Peach needed for making Angler Kayvan's special bait. It seems nothing different than a regular Zaytun Peach.
Water collected in Vanarana, clear, cold, and refreshing — a leaf falling on top of it would look as if floating in the air. This is transparent water of extraordinary quality.

This is certainly not a new pocket watch. But you can tell that it has been carefully polished, evidence of how much the owner really cares about it. Inside is a photograph centering on a young girl from Snezhnaya.
This looks like a Fatui insignia, but it's all scratched up somehow.

This time, we are looking for a kitten named Lale with black and white fur. If you wish to call for Lale's attention in cat language, you need to say "Meow, meow meow meow, meeeeow!" with the tone going downward then upward, before ending on an even higher note.
Flowers that grow in wetlands in the forest and bloom at night. Their fresh petals are important ingredients for the treatment of Eleazar.
A flower sprouting in the faded Withering Zone, tender yet tough.
The brave young ones known as Javans are said to have this tough eagle feather as their symbol.
A talisman woven with childish skills. Its meaning remains unknown. The Dendro energy in it keeps the flower fresh for a long time. But apart from that, there is nothing special about this talisman.
Mushrooms collected at the location designated by Hanbei. Although these mushrooms grow on tree trunks, they don't look special at all. They aren't going to cause any trouble, are they?
A Sumeru Rose affected by the Ley Lines. It seems a little different from normal...
"A mirror not made of glass reflects every drama."
description.1: Another riddle you got from the chest indicated by the previous riddle.
description.2: Who wrote these riddles...
description.3: Maybe the answer is hidden somewhere associated with dramas?

description.0: Shipbuilding materials Rafiq bought. You've heard that these have cost him a fortune...
It looks like an ordinary little dried flower, but it was once a precious gift. It deserves to be cherished, just like the forgotten friendship of the past.

Canned Knowledge labeled "Swordfighting Techniques VIII." It was bought from Dori's booth at the price of 100,000 Mora at Paimon's instigation. You have no idea where the first seven in the series are, but things like "Combat Techniques" will always be useful. Well, probably.

Notes penned by the Fatui researcher Persikov. These notes contain a map, and if you follow its instructions, you should be able to find the crystalline cores that the Cognitive Mimicry device is missing...
Viktor bought this. He claims that he'll use it to do wood carving.
A meal box containing two Panipuri. Viktor and Vsevolod should be a little hungry by now...
A treasure map placed at the bottom of a box. It indicates the location of the "good stuff" with simple markings.
A piece of the Primal Construct that barred your path. This component seems to be reacting with nearby devices, constantly gleaming and glinting as it does.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Either way, researchers believe this symbol to have initially stood for "valley."

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Most believe the etchings here symbolize a bird's head.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Either way, researchers believe this symbol to have been a phonetic symbol, and that its extended meanings may have included respect or submission.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The shape of this symbol should be derived from the storms that ravage the desert.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The symbol on this plate looks like an auricle, but a consensus has not been reached on this matter.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? A majority of researchers believe this to represent the forest, and that this suggests that the modern-day desert was not always a desolate wasteland.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The shape of this symbol should be derived from the lightning that is ever so rare a sight in the desert.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The symbol seems to indicate the hazardous circumstance of hanging a chisel hammer on a cliff, and is thought to have emerged at a later date.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The symbol for a chisel hammer is one of the earliest words to emerge.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The origin of this symbol is the rising sun.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? This symbol is the spitting image of a ruler seated upon a throne.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building, though the origin of this writing seems unclear. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Most believe that the etchings here symbolize a sheep's head.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The source of this symbol is probably the Spinocrocodile's frighteningly huge maw.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Though Haravatat researchers believe this to be a symbol for a giant serpent, Amurta researchers have proposed a different view, arguing that the Great Red Sand is not home to any snakes. As such, the meaning of and inspiration for this word is still being contested.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The original meaning of this symbol was most likely "sacrifice," with an extended meaning of "rites" or "ceremonies" emerging later.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The symbol here appeared at the same time as the chisel hammer, and is one of the earliest words to emerge.

A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The civilization from the era of King Deshret had different words for dunes of different shapes, something that has brought researchers no lack of headaches.

Compared to Sumeru Roses, Golden Roses are a unique species more suited to the deserts. To survive, it has had to protect itself with a shield of mud and stone, but in the right environment, it may yet recoup its original beauty.
A stone slate that you found in the transparent ruins near the Mausoleum of King Deshret. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.
A stone slate that you found in the secret Eremite base within Lamb-Devourer Rock. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.

RecordOfTheTombOfCarouses.name: Record of the Tomb of Carouses

description.0: A stone slate that you found in the Tomb of Carouses. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.
These are the notes left by Soheil, an Akademiya researcher, who entered the desert to study when he was young. They look very old, but they are not crinkled.
A stone slate that you found at the highest point of the Mausoleum of King Deshret. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.

The script for "Drama Phantasmagoria: Tale of the Sword-Wielding Princess!" The meandering scribbles appended to the script seem to be annotations from the theater troupe head, some of which contain such radical instructions as to render their adoption unlikely in the extreme.
A freshly picked Harra Fruit. Perfect for cooking.
An unsigned note. No one knows who left it...

This device, developed by alchemist Hajanad, is cleverly designed with an internal chamber capable of withstanding high pressure and high temperature to withstand the explosion from the "remelting effect". The special valve can be opened automatically at the right time to release the fully mixed medicament smoke and provide the user with assistance in combat. However, judging from some of its details, this experiment seems to be suffering from a shortage of funds. Hajanad's research doesn't seem to be all that well-funded...

A masterpiece of the alchemist Hajanad, a truly special solid potion. Theoretically, this alchemy tablet can be stored for a long time and is quite safe and easy to carry and transport. However, when in use, the tablet needs to be put into the "remelting device," where the two solid agents will be mixed via micro-explosion to obtain complete efficacy.
description.1: And it is always a little disturbing to think that the device in hand may explode...
